result.execSummary:
The defendant Romelle A. Clipps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall complete a parenting class recommended by the Dodge County Human Services Department;

Shall comply with any and all requirements set by Dodge County Human Services Department; Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Shall engage in no physical discipline.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

12:52 - Defendant Romelle A. Clipps in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan (not eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JAC or his residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.
